categories.name: Cinematic Universes: Beyond Marvel and DC

questions.clue: This cinematic universe features giant monsters like Godzilla and King Kong battling each other.
Vin Diesel stars in this high-octane universe known for its fast cars and daring heists.
Based on a popular toy line, this universe involves Autobots and Decepticons fighting on Earth.
The Valiant Comics universe launched its first film with Vin Diesel portraying the character 'Bloodshot'.
This universe combines classic movie monsters like Dracula, the Mummy, and the Invisible Man, but struggled after 'The Mummy' (2017).
This ancient wonder, located in Giza, Egypt, is the largest pyramid in the world.
The Parthenon, a symbol of ancient Greece, is located on this famous hill in Athens.
This ancient city, known for its rock-cut architecture, is located in present-day Jordan.
The ziggurat is a type of massive structure built in ancient Mesopotamia with this distinctive step-like design.
This ancient Roman structure, known for its large dome, was dedicated to all the gods of pagan Rome.
This novel begins, 'Call me Ishmael.'
This famous line starts, 'It was the best of times, it was the worst of times...'
Identify the book with the opening line, 'All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.'
This novel begins with, 'It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.'
Name the novel that starts with, 'In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit.'
This scientist won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921 for his discovery of the photoelectric effect.
In 1962, this scientist and his partner James Watson shared a Nobel Prize for their discovery of the DNA structure.
This physicist and chemist is the only person to have won Nobel Prizes in two different sciences, in 1903 for Physics and in 1911 for Chemistry.
Awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1986, this inventor is known for his development of the scanning tunneling microscope.
This physicist won the Nobel Prize in 1938 for his discovery of nuclear fission, which laid the groundwork for nuclear reactors.

categories.name: World Capitals: Off the Beaten Path

questions.clue: The capital of Mongolia, this city is known for its proximity to the Gobi Desert.
Known as the 'Land of a Thousand Hills', Rwanda's capital is this city.
This capital of Bhutan is unique for not having any traffic lights.
Situated on the Arabian Peninsula, this Omani capital is known for its stunning architecture and port.
Located in the Pacific Ocean, this capital of the Marshall Islands is known for its atolls and shipwrecks.

final.clue: In 1876, Alexander Graham Bell famously called to his assistant using this invention, which was patented that same year.
